div.h2: Schedule for the Remainder of the 2019-20 School Year

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;

p.span: -BSD eLearning resumes the week of April 6th.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;

p.span: -Our schedule allows for a combination of eLearning days and waiver days provided by the Governor.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;

p.span: -Monday, Wednesday and Friday will be eLearning days for students.

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 12pt; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;

p.span: -Tuesday and Thursday will not be eLearning days for students, however, students are encouraged to use these days to finish and submit work.

p.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;

font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; border: none; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; width: 274px; height: 266px; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;
font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;

p.span: We miss our students! We appreciate your patience, cooperation and support as we work together to navigate this difficult and unprecedented time.

span.style: white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;

p.span: Please contact the Elementary or Jr.-Sr. High School offices regarding school specific needs.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif;
background-color: transparent; font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif; font-size: 16px; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Each week, we will offer curbside pick-up for participating families every Tuesday from 11:30 - 1 PM. Each participating child will receive 5 lunches and 5 breakfasts for the week. We are asking families to use the “drive-through” that will be setup in the bus lot. When it is your turn in line, please pull forward and open your trunk or tailgate from inside your vehicle. Our volunteers will be wearing gloves and masks and will put the groceries in your vehicle for you. Please do not exit your vehicles.

span.style: font-size: 16px;
font-size: 16px;
font-family: Montserrat, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 16px;

p.span: If you decide your family no longer needs the meals, please let us know by calling 812-384-2401 or 812-384-9520. The BSD cafeteria has experienced limitations for some items we order. Each Tuesday, we only package enough meals for the expected number of participants who have indicated their participation in the program. If you decide your family no longer needs the meals, please let us know by calling 812-384-2401 or 812-384-9520. Thank you for your continued patience as we work our way "out" of this crisis.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: Welcome to the Bloomfield School District. We serve grades PK-12 on one campus – which includes Bloomfield Elementary School (PK through Grade 6) and Bloomfield Jr.-Sr. High School (Grades 7-12). Our students are pushed to learn and achieve academically through a variety of core curriculum and support services that meet the unique educational, social and emotional needs of each child. Our faculty and staff work with students and their parents to provide quality educational opportunities in a structured, safe and supportive learning environment.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: As superintendent, I am proud of the opportunities our district continues to provide for our students. Bloomfield Elementary School offers a robust curriculum, including we Engineering is Elementary. We believe in inspiring innovation in today's classrooms to engage students in discovering their inner engineer as they become lifelong STEM learners. Bloomfield Jr.-Sr. High School offers students an educational experience supported by our Digital Learning Initiative. All students in grades 7-12 are issued a Lenovo 11E Chromebooks at the start of each school year. Bloomfield Jr.-Sr. High School offers students the opportunity to earn college credits at little or no cost to parents, we are the only school in Greene County to be accredited an Early College High School by the Center for Excellence in Leadership of Learning at the University of Indianapolis. We support an active FFA which participates in state competitions, as well as a world class NJROTC program that was recognized as a Distinguished Unit for Area 3 last school year.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: These are just a few examples of the wonderful activities taking place in our schools. If you are interested in joining the Bloomfield community, please contact me directly at (812) 384-4507. I would love to share with you all of the reasons why Bloomfield School District is a very special place.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;
